name: Add direct spec argument to construct command
notes: Allow `ralph construct coverage.md` to work directly without needing `ralph plan` first. If no tasks exist for that spec, either auto-run plan or error gracefully. Implementation in cmd_run() around line 4328.
accept: Running `ralph construct foo.md` without prior `ralph plan` either auto-plans or shows helpful error

name: Unify timeout unit to milliseconds in CLI
notes: Spec says `--timeout <ms>` but CLI currently uses seconds (default 900s). Either change CLI to accept milliseconds or update spec. Prefer matching spec: change CLI to use ms. Location: line 4211 in powerplant/ralph.
accept: `ralph construct --timeout 300000` works (300 seconds), help text shows milliseconds

name: Add critical path analysis to task prioritize
notes: Current prioritize only counts direct blockers. Spec requires: 1) Build true dependency graph structure, 2) Calculate critical path (longest path to completion), 3) Count transitive dependents not just direct blockers, 4) Use critical path position in priority assignment. Location: lines 3902-3965 in powerplant/ralph.
accept: `ralph task prioritize` considers critical path - tasks on longest path get higher priority than equal-blocking tasks off critical path

name: Add individual task accept by ID
notes: Current `ralph task accept` accepts ALL done tasks at once. Spec requires accepting individual tasks: `ralph task accept <id>`. Needed for VERIFY stage fork/join pattern where each subagent accepts/rejects its assigned task. Location: lines 3858-3867 in powerplant/ralph.
accept: `ralph task accept t-xxxx` accepts only that specific task, leaving other done tasks

name: Add individual task reject by ID
notes: Current `ralph task reject "reason"` rejects only the FIRST done task. Spec requires rejecting by ID: `ralph task reject <id> "reason"`. Needed for VERIFY fork/join pattern. Location: lines 3870-3886 in powerplant/ralph.
accept: `ralph task reject t-xxxx "failed tests"` rejects that specific task with reason

name: Add --done flag to ralph query tasks
notes: Spec VERIFY stage (lines 288-289) describes `ralph query tasks --done` to get only done tasks for parallel verification. Currently only `ralph query tasks` exists returning both pending and done. Location: cmd_query function in powerplant/ralph.
accept: `ralph query tasks --done` returns JSON with only done tasks

name: Implement context compaction strategy
notes: Current compaction at 85% is a stub that immediately fails. Implement actual compaction per spec (lines 415-445): 1) Preserve: current task, edited files, uncommitted changes, recent errors, key decisions, 2) Summarize: exploration results, tool outputs, code reads, 3) Discard: verbose output, full file contents, redundant exploration, 4) Output COMPACTED CONTEXT format. Location: lines 3496-3521 in powerplant/ralph.
accept: At 85% context, compaction produces summary and context drops below 70%, allowing execution to resume

name: Add ralph query iteration command
notes: Spec (line 588) requires `ralph query iteration` to return current iteration number. Currently iteration is only tracked during construct mode runs but not exposed via CLI query. Location: cmd_query function in powerplant/ralph.
accept: `ralph query iteration` returns current iteration number as integer

name: Add priority field to Issue dataclass
notes: Spec (line 93) says INVESTIGATE stage tasks should inherit priority from the originating issue. Current Issue dataclass (lines 468-479) has no priority field. Add optional priority field so issues can carry priority to their derived tasks.
accept: Issue dataclass has priority field; tasks created from issues inherit the priority

name: Add tombstone support to ralph log --all
notes: Spec (ralph-plan-system.md line 298-300) marks `ralph log --all` tombstone support as unchecked. When showing git history, should distinguish accepted tasks (completed successfully) from rejected tasks (have tombstone records). Location: cmd_log function in powerplant/ralph.
accept: `ralph log --all` shows rejected tasks with different marker/indicator than accepted tasks

name: Enable context warning in interactive mode
notes: Current 70% context warning only fires in non-interactive mode (line 3487 has `if not interactive` check). Should also warn in interactive/TUI mode. Location: monitor_limits function around line 3487 in powerplant/ralph.
accept: Context warning appears at 70% in both interactive and non-interactive modes
